title: Reconstructing the Hubble parameter with future Gravitational Wave missions using Machine Learning. (arXiv:2303.05169v1 [astro-ph.CO] CROSS LISTED)
abstract: We study the prospects of Machine Learning algorithms like Gaussian processes (GP) as a tool to reconstruct the Hubble parameter $H(z)$ with two upcoming gravitational wave missions, namely the evolved Laser Interferometer Space Antenna (eLISA) and the Einstein Telescope (ET). We perform non-parametric reconstructions of $H(z)$ with GP using realistically generated catalogues, assuming various background cosmological models, for each mission. We also take into account the effect of early-time and late-time priors separately on the reconstruction, and hence on the Hubble constant ($H_0$). Our analysis reveals that GPs are quite robust in reconstructing the expansion history of the Universe within the observational window of the specific mission under study. 本文研究机器学习算法（如高斯过程）在利用两个即将到来的引力波任务（即进化的激光干涉空间天线和爱因斯坦望远镜）重建哈勃参数$H(z)$的前景。我们使用具有各种背景宇宙学模型的现实生成的目录进行高斯过程的$H(z)$的非参数重建，为每个任务单独重建。我们还分别考虑早期和晚期先验对重构和哈勃常数($H_0$)的影响。我们的分析表明，高斯过程在特定的研究任务的观测窗口内重建宇宙的膨胀历史相当稳健。我们进一步证实，进化的激光干涉空间天线和爱因斯坦望远镜都将能够比今天更高精度地约束$H(z)$和$H_0$，并找出它们在每个模型中解决哈勃张力的可能角色，以具体情况而定。

因此，本文的创新和贡献在于使用机器学习算法（高斯过程）重建哈勃参数$H(z)$，并利用进化的激光干涉空间天线和爱因斯坦望远镜数据实现更高精度的约束，从而有可能解决哈勃张力问题。
